revision.text:
{{Wireless embedded system |brand=TP-LINK |model=TL-WR340G |revision=v2.2 |upc= |ean= |asin= |price= |est_release_date= |fcc_date=08/30/2007 |manuf_country=China |manuf= |manuf_model= |manuf_rev= |availability= |type=wireless router |fcc_id=TE7WR340G |ic_id= |pwr_v=9 |pwr_amp=0.6 |pwr_conn=barrel |pwr_barrel_inner= |pwr_barrel_outer= |pwr_barrel_len= |pwr_vac= |pwr_pol= |pwr_poe= |cpu1_brand=Atheros |cpu1_model=AR2317 |cpu1_cspeed= |cpu2_brand= |cpu2_model= |cpu2_cspeed= |fla1=2 |fla1_brand=Spansion |fla1_model=FL016AIF |fla1_num= |fla2= |fla2_brand= |fla2_model= |fla2_num= |ram1=8 |ram1_brand=Elpida |ram1_model=S6416AHTA-75-E |ram1_num= |ram2= |ram2_brand= |ram2_model= |ram2_num= |expansion_if_types= |expansion_pcmcia_num= |expansion_expresscard_num= |expansion_minipci_num= |expansion_minipcie_num= |expansion_usb_num= |jtag= |serial= |wi1_module= |wi1_module_if= |wi1_chip1_brand=Atheros |wi1_chip1_model=AR2317 |wi1_chip2_brand= |wi1_chip2_model= |wi1_chip3_brand= |wi1_chip3_model= |wi1_802dot11_protocols=bg |wi1_ant_conn= |wi1_txchains= |wi1_rxchains= |wi1_sstreams= |wi2_module= |wi2_module_if= |wi2_chip1_brand= |wi2_chip1_model= |wi2_chip2_brand= |wi2_chip2_model= |wi2_chip3_brand= |wi2_chip3_model= |wi2_802dot11_protocols= |wi2_ant_conn= |wi2_txchains= |wi2_rxchains= |wi2_sstreams= |eth_none= |eth_cpu=true |eth_chip1_brand= |eth_chip1_model= |eth_chip2_brand= |eth_chip2_model= |eth_chip3_brand= |eth_chip3_model= |sw_cpu= |sw_brand=Marvell |sw_model=88E6060 |lan_speed=100M |lan_ports=4 |wan_ports=1 |flags= |tp_firmware= |802dot11_protocols=bg |default_ssid= |default_ssid_regex= |default_ip=192.168.1.1 |default_user=admin |default_pass=admin |oui=00:27:19 |oui_eth=00:27:19 }} [http://www.tp-link.com/en/products/details/?model=TL-WR340G TL-WR340G product page]
Same as the TL-WR340GD aside from the antenna configuration. The TL-WR340G has an integral antenna. The TL-WR340GD has a RP-SMA connector.
There are multiple revisions of this device. I don't know what the differences between v1 and v2 (and others) are. v3 switches to an Atheros AR8236 switch (see below DD-WRT forums thread).
00:27:19 OUI is from a v2.22 device.
[http://www.dd-wrt.com/phpBB2/viewtopic.php?p=200635 On the DD-WRT forums] (part details, links to high-res images of v3 via Dropbox)
